alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 3:11AM EDT until July 29 at 4:30AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL PENOBSCOT AND SOUTHEASTERN AROOSTOOK COUNTIES... At 311 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Although rain is coming to an end, between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Millinocket, East Millinocket, Sherman, Island Falls, Haynesville, Sherman Station, Reed Plantation, southern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Baxter State Park, Linneus, Stacyville, Crystal, Orient, Glenwood, Silver Ridge, Monarda, Benedicta, Grindstone and Forkstown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
